info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 27 at 8:12AM CDT until April 27 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Ozark and Taney.
* WHEN...Until 215 PM CDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 812 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Pond Fork at County Road 883, Possum Walk Creek at Highway T, Spring Creek at County Road 349, Little North Fork at Haskins Ford Road, Lick Creek at County Road 528, Little North Fork River at County Road 916 and Turkey Creek at County Road 830. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Forsyth, Gainesville, Taneyville, Bakersfield, Kissee Mills, Theodosia, Pontiac, Sundown, Isabella, Thornfield, Long Run, Noble, Willhoit, Rueter, Protem, Hardenville, Zanoni, Bradleyville, Tecumseh, Sycamore, Udall, Bull Shoals Lake, Norfork Lake and Lake Taneycomo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
